item.title: Common lungwort (*Pulmonaria officinalis*)
item.description: Common lungwort is a medicinal plant that grows in spring and blooms in pink and purple colours. The tincture and tea from Pulmonaria officinalis are used to treat respiratory ailments, coughs and hoarseness.

item.title: Creeping thyme (*Thymus serpyllum*)
item.description: The remarkably fragrant dwarf shrub of the creeping thyme prefers growing on stony ground, and its healing effects are helpful for coughs, colds, and indigestion.

item.title: Sweet wormwood (Artemisia annua)
item.description: Sweet wormwood is a highly beneficial medicinal plant with proven effects in treating malaria and cancer. It is traditionally used for various ailments and diseases, from viral illnesses to menstrual cramps.
